alert.note: Alert for Bladen (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 04 at 8:20PM EST until January 08 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Wilmington NC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Carolina... Cape Fear River At Elizabethtown affecting Bladen County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cape Fear River At Elizabethtown. * WHEN...From late tonight to Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Floodwaters will affect farmers` fields adjacent to the river requiring the movement of farm equipment to higher ground. The lower part of Cape Owen Manor Road may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 27.0 feet Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Friday evening. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 27.0 feet on 02/18/1984. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Cape Fear River Elizabethtown 25.0 MSG unknown 26.9 26.9 25.0 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps2/index. php?wfo=ilm The next statement will be issued Wednesday afternoon at 230 PM EST.
